Generation I.Red: Using its ability to read minds, it will identify impending danger and Teleport to safety.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Using its ability to read minds, it will identify impending danger and Teleport to safety.
Generation I.Yellow: Sleeps 18 hours a day. If it senses danger, it will teleport itself to safety even as it sleeps.
Generation I.Stadium: Even while asleep, it can sense enemies approaching. It Teleport s itself to a distant spot if there is any danger.

Generation II.Gold: It senses impending attacks and Teleport s away to safety before the actual attacks can strike.
Generation II.Silver: If it decides to Teleport randomly, it creates the illusion that it has created copies of itself.
Generation II.Crystal: It hypnotizes itself so that it can teleport away when it senses danger, even if it is asleep.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It senses impending attacks and Teleport s away to safety before the actual attacks can strike. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) If it decides to Teleport randomly, it creates the illusion that it has created copies of itself. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Abra sleeps for eighteen hours a day. However, it can sense the presence of foes even while it is sleeping. In such a situation, this Pok é mon immediately teleports to safety.
Generation III.Sapphire: Abra needs to sleep for eighteen hours a day. If it doesn't, this Pok é mon loses its ability to use telekinetic powers. If it is attacked, Abra escapes using Teleport while it is still sleeping.
Generation III.Emerald: A Pok é mon that sleeps 18 hours a day. Observation revealed that it uses Teleport to change its location once every hour.
Generation III.FireRed: It sleeps for 18 hours a day. It uses a variety of extrasensory powers even while asleep.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Using its ability to read minds, it will sense impending danger and Teleport to safety.

Generation IV.Diamond: It sleeps for 18 hours a day. Even when awake, it teleports itself while remaining seated.
Generation IV.Pearl: Even while asleep, it maintains a telepathic radar. It teleports when it is threatened.
Generation IV.Platinum: Using its psychic power is such a strain on its brain that it needs to sleep for 18 hours a day.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It senses impending attacks and teleports away to safety before the actual attacks can strike.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: If it decides to teleport randomly, it evokes the illusion that it has created copies of itself.

Generation V.Black: Using its psychic power is such a strain on its brain that it needs to sleep for 18 hours a day.
Generation V.White: Using its psychic power is such a strain on its brain that it needs to sleep for 18 hours a day.
Generation V.Black 2: Using its psychic power is such a strain on its brain that it needs to sleep for 18 hours a day.
Generation V.White 2: Using its psychic power is such a strain on its brain that it needs to sleep for 18 hours a day.

Generation VI.X: It sleeps for 18 hours a day. It uses a variety of extrasensory powers even while asleep.
Generation VI.Y: It senses impending attacks and teleports away to safety before the actual attacks can strike.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Abra sleeps for eighteen hours a day. However, it can sense the presence of foes even while it is sleeping. In such a situation, this Pokémon immediately teleports to safety.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Abra needs to sleep for eighteen hours a day. If it doesn't, this Pokémon loses its ability to use telekinetic powers. If it is attacked, Abra escapes using Teleport while it is still sleeping.

Generation VII.Sun: It sleeps 18 hours a day. Even while sleeping, it will teleport itself to treetops and pick and eat berries there.
Generation VII.Moon: It can teleport itself to safety while it's asleep, but when it wakes, it doesn't know where it is, so it panics.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It uses various psychic powers even while it's sleeping, so you can't tell whether or not it's awake.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It can read others' minds and will teleport away when danger approaches. You must clear your mind if you want to catch it.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Sleeps 18 hours a day. If it senses danger, it will teleport itself to safety even as it sleeps.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Sleeps 18 hours a day. If it senses danger, it will teleport itself to safety even as it sleeps.

Generation VIII.Sword: This Pokémon uses its psychic powers while it sleeps. The contents of Abra's dreams affect the powers that the Pokémon wields.
Generation VIII.Shield: Abra can teleport in its sleep. Apparently the more deeply Abra sleeps, the farther its teleportations go.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It sleeps for 18 hours a day. Even when awake, it teleports itself while remaining seated.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Even while asleep, it maintains a telepathic radar. It teleports when it is threatened.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Spends 18 hours of the day sleeping. Even while asleep, Abra can control its psychic powers—should danger approach, the Pokémon will simply teleport away.
